canDo: I can talk about travel experiences and make simple travel arrangements.

grammar.point: Present perfect for travel experiences, going to for travel plans

rules.title: Have you ever + past participle?
rules.explanation: Use 'Have you ever...?' to ask about life experiences. Answer with 'Yes, I have' or 'No, I haven't'.
examples: Have you ever been to Japan?
rules.koreanTip: 'Have you ever ~?'는 '~해 본 적 있어?'라는 뜻이에요. 경험을 물을 때 써요.

rules.title: Been to vs. Gone to
rules.explanation: 'Been to' means visited and returned. 'Gone to' means went and hasn't returned yet.
examples: I've been to Paris twice. (visited and came back)
She's gone to the store. (she's still there)
rules.koreanTip: 'been to'는 다녀왔다(돌아옴), 'gone to'는 갔다(아직 안 돌아옴)는 의미예요.

rules.title: Going to for travel plans
rules.explanation: Use 'be going to' to talk about planned trips.
examples: I'm going to visit Spain next summer.
We're going to stay at a hotel.
Are you going to travel alone?
rules.koreanTip: 여행 계획을 말할 때 'be going to + 동사원형'을 써요.

exercises.question: Have you ever ___ to Europe?
exercises.explanation: Use 'been to' in present perfect to ask about places visited.
exercises.koreanTip: 경험을 물을 때는 'Have you ever been to ~?'를 써요.

exercises.question: I've ___ been to Australia. I want to go someday.
exercises.explanation: 'Never' is used to say you haven't had an experience.

exercises.question: Where is Tom? He's ___ to the airport to pick up his friend.
exercises.explanation: 'Gone to' means he left and hasn't returned yet.

exercises.question: Which question asks about experience?
options: Have you ever been to Japan?
exercises.correctAnswer: Have you ever been to Japan?
exercises.explanation: 'Have you ever been to...?' asks about life experience.

words.meaning: the place you are traveling to
examples: Paris is a popular tourist destination.
The itinerary includes a city tour.
words.koreanTip: 여행 일정표를 의미해요. 발음 주의: 아이티너레리

examples: We went sightseeing in the city.
Sightseeing is my favorite travel activity.

words.meaning: something bought to remember a place
examples: I bought some souvenirs for my family.
This magnet is a souvenir from Paris.

reading.title: My Dream Trip to Japan
reading.passage: I've always wanted to visit Japan, and next month, my dream is finally coming true! I'm going to spend two weeks there. First, I'll fly to Tokyo and stay there for five days. I'm going to visit famous places like Shibuya and Asakusa. I've heard that Tokyo has amazing food, so I'm going to try lots of sushi and ramen. After Tokyo, I'm taking the bullet train to Kyoto. I've never seen real Japanese temples before, so I'm really excited! My friend who has been to Japan three times recommended staying at a traditional Japanese inn called a ryokan. I've already booked my accommodation and made an itinerary. I can't wait!

questions.question: How long will the writer stay in Japan?
questions.explanation: The passage says 'I'm going to spend two weeks there.'

questions.question: How will the writer travel from Tokyo to Kyoto?
questions.explanation: The passage says 'I'm taking the bullet train to Kyoto.'

questions.question: What is a 'ryokan'?
questions.explanation: The passage explains it as 'a traditional Japanese inn called a ryokan.'

listening.title: At the Travel Agency
listening.script: Hello, how can I help you today? Hi, I'd like to book a trip to Bali. Have you ever been to Bali before? No, this will be my first time. When would you like to travel? I'm thinking about going in July. How long do you plan to stay? About a week. Would you like me to book accommodation as well? Yes, please. I'd like a beachfront hotel if possible. Perfect! I'll find you the best options. Do you need a round-trip ticket or one-way? Round-trip, please. Great, let me put together an itinerary for you.

exercises.question: Where does the customer want to travel?
exercises.explanation: The customer says 'I'd like to book a trip to Bali.'

exercises.question: The customer wants to stay at a ___ hotel.
exercises.explanation: The customer says 'I'd like a beachfront hotel if possible.'

template.prompt: Write about a past trip or a planned trip.
template.template: I [HAVE BEEN/AM GOING] to [DESTINATION]. [WHEN]. I [STAYED/WILL STAY] at [ACCOMMODATION] for [DURATION]. [ACTIVITY SENTENCE]. The [BEST/MOST EXCITING] thing was/will be [HIGHLIGHT]. I [BOUGHT/WILL BUY] [SOUVENIR] as a souvenir.
template.correctExample: I have been to Thailand. I went there last summer. I stayed at a beach resort for one week. I went snorkeling and visited beautiful temples. The best thing was the street food. I bought a silk scarf as a souvenir.

free.prompt: Write about a place you have visited or want to visit. Include what you did/will do and why you liked/would like it.

checklist.item: Use present perfect or 'going to' correctly
Describe why you liked/want to visit the place

shadowing.sentence: Have you ever been to Europe? I've been to France and Italy, but I've never been to Spain. I'm going to visit Barcelona next year.
shadowing.pronunciation: /hæv juː ˈevər biːn tuː ˈjʊrəp aɪv biːn tuː fræns ænd ˈɪtəli bət aɪv ˈnevər biːn tuː speɪn aɪm ˈɡoʊɪŋ tuː ˈvɪzɪt ˌbɑːrsəˈloʊnə nekst jɪr/

roleplay.scenario: You are talking about travel experiences with a friend.

prompts.speaker: user

koreanErrors.errorExample: I have ever been to Japan.
koreanErrors.explanation: 'Ever' is used in questions, not in positive statements.
koreanErrors.tip: 'ever'는 의문문에서 써요. 긍정문에서는 그냥 'I have been to'를 써요.

koreanErrors.errorExample: I've been to the store. (when you're still there)
koreanErrors.explanation: 'Been to' = visited and returned. 'Gone to' = went and still there.
koreanErrors.tip: 돌아왔으면 'been to', 아직 거기 있으면 'gone to'예요.

koreanErrors.errorExample: Have you ever gone to Paris?
koreanErrors.correctForm: Have you ever been to Paris?
koreanErrors.explanation: Use 'been to' when asking about visiting a place in someone's life.
koreanErrors.tip: 경험을 물을 때는 'Have you ever been to ~?'가 맞아요.
